data.title: Returning guest
data.text: I've been here before and will keep coming back. Especially since they can prepare a drink... Caipirinha. Forewarning, this drink is a little strong. Since the menu is all good, a friend and I go on a semi-empty stomach and make sure we have our fill.

data.title: No Weapons Allowed
data.text:
Stopped by with the family for dinner,  food was good.   However,  they don't allow conceal carry.   Even with the country under an active terror threat. 

Had I knew before parking,  would of went somewhere else.   Odd that a constitutional carry state like Arizona would have restaurants with such restrictions still. 

Seems Petty until you need it.

data.title: Treat your Customers Better
data.text:
Dear Sushi Garden,

I understand that you have won best sushi in Tucson for the past several years. Yes, your sushi is indeed very tasty. However, just because you serve delicious food does not mean that your staff can act like a bunch of jerks. On Saturday, September 10th at around 5:30 pm I went to Sushi Garden (Speedway and Alvernon location) for dinner. The customer service was nothing short of horrifying. The one exception would be the hostess, but even she looked like she hated her life.

We were seated in the middle of the first section of tables, surrounded on all sides by other tables. It was pretty busy at the time, so all of the tables around us were full. For this reason the waiters thought it would be a great idea to use our table as a resting place for items that they were carrying to and from the kitchen. Thus my husband and I had the pleasure of eating our dinner next to other peoples dirty plates, empty serving trays and other random assortments of crap that should have been nowhere near our table. Disrespectful, unsanitary and completely insulting. I would like to point out this occurred seven times throughout our meal (yes, I was counting).

Besides the garbage dump table I was sitting at, the waiter appeared to have no interest in us being there at all. When we asked for another order of sushi she seemed irritated by the request. Oh I'm sorry, should I not be ordering food here? Come on guys, do you want to be a successful business or not? Last time I checked the reason why people go to restaurants is because they feel the hard earned money they have worked so hard for is worth spending. NEWSFLASH, if you treat your customers like cattle they will not come back no matter how good the food is.

No joke the customer service at Sushi Garden was appalling. However, I will say it is the best sushi I have had so far in Tucson. My husband and I did the all you can eat sushi for $21.95 a person, which includes not only sushi but appetizers as well. For appetizers we ordered the crab puffs and the beef dumplings. The crab puffs were perfectly crispy on the outside and fluffy, rich and cream cheesy on the inside. What was impressive about them was that they actually tasted more like crab than they did like cream cheese. Most of the crab puffs I have had in this town taste like there is no crab in them at all. For the sushi we ordered the Las Vegas Roll, Spicy Tuna Roll, Tuna Sashimi and Eel Sashimi.

By FAR, Sushi Garden has the best Las Vegas Rolls. Why? The frying is light and airy, crisp and clean. It tastes fresh; unlike all other sushi restaurants that taste like they fried their sushi a month ago. They add the perfect amount of eel sauce, not too much and not too little. The Spicy Tuna was also very tasty. This was actually the first time I have ever tried Sashimi, and I realize now that I am not a huge fan...WAY too much raw at one time. The second I took a bit I was reminded of how easily I could get E.coli. The Eel Sashimi on the other hand was cooked and delicious. It was creamy and sweet, with a buttery chicken-like texture and mild crab-like sweetness. Did you know if a chicken and a crab have sex they produce a baby eel? You learn something new everyday.

The interior of Sushi Garden is beautiful, each room is decorated with different shapes and colors. However it tends to get extremely loud almost all the time, which drastically affects the atmosphere of the place. Despite the unspeakable service at Sushi Garden, the food is quite tasty. Just make sure to pop some Ibuprofen before heading over. For this and other restaurant review visit destroy the freezer dot com.

data.title: Loved it!
data.text: First experience was outstanding! Great location, great food, great service, great feeling. Will go back the first chance we get!

data.title: I would not go here again...
data.text: I love Sushi.  I eat it wherever and whenever i can. I recently  had a short trip to Tucson and went there for the All you can Eat Sushi. Maybe the regular menu might be better, but the "all you can eat" one was not good. I had a salmon roll that was like no other salmon roll i ever ate! mushed up salmon in this huge roll that didnt taste good at all. The sushi chefs were rushing as fast as they could to get meals out... in my opinion without a care... just get it out. I think sushi is all in the presentation as well and this was not good.   If you go i would stay away from the all you can eat menu and maybe try a specialty..... sorry.. i wanted to like it... but didnt

data.title: Just ok
data.text: Nothing special. Buffet is ok. Good buffet if a few cows want to do some grazing . All you can eat. Fried food, greasy, sushi a lot of rice. Other stuff not sure what it was.. Yicks

data.title: If there was a minus 1 , it would get it.
data.text:
This was my first and last visit to Sushi Garden.  Two of us went for lunch, we arrived at 11:45, and they had not opened for lunch yet.  We hung out in the Foothills Mall until about 12:10. We choose to eat the Buffet lunch. Our mistake.   You would think that since they had just opened, the food would have been hot.  NOT !!!  Cold food is not my idea of a hot lunch.  
We will never return.

data.title: Not horrible, but could be much better
data.text: I have been to many sushi restaurants. This one isn't bad, but far from the best. For $21 plus change you can get all you can eat option. But it is not really all you can eat. You can order only 5 items from the very limited portion of the menu. Better restaurants for the same all-you-can-eat option would limit only fancy dishes, such as caviar sushi, which is understandable. This one will serve you only basic stuff. Did it taste good? Yes. But you might as well pay $10 at the Chinese buffet, and would get slightly less choice of sushi, and it will be unlimited. Expectations were higher.

data.title: Terrible
data.text: Chinese buffets have better sushi than sushi garden. Wife and I got the all you can eat and we ordered a handful of stuff. We got about halfway through our order and couldn't stomach it anymore. Waitress said they were going to charge us for wasting food and I was fine with that. 5 bucks to never go back, I'm fine with that.

data.title: Gone Fishin'  in style
data.text: I've eaten here twice now, and I've been impressed both times.  Having grown up on the ocean in Cali, I am always wary of eating fish in the desert, but Sushi Garden is impressive.  Their fish is fresh, their rolls are tight, and the service is first rate.  If you're really hungry, try the all you can eat sushi, but be sure to clean your plate.  They charge extra if you have food left-over.

data.title: No Go
data.text:
only because the all you can eat menu has shrunk to about half of what it used to be. Still the same price,  no more Bonsai roll, limited tuna, plus only one on some items. 
head elsewhere.

data.title: ok sushi
data.text: it was good sushi but not great....the all you can eat sushi was limited choices but what do think your going to get for 21.95!....the tempura was very good and a large portion....the service was fine for dinner.

data.title: OK Buffet...don't go late...GREAT Value
data.text:
We arrived just before 2pm when they were about to close, so the selection was not great but the sushi and other dishes were OK. The Vegetable Udon Soup was very good, large portion and fresh veggies. The Yakisoba noodles were also good.
The value of the buffet is very good, only $9.95 per person...no sharing!
If you are in that area it is worth it. We sat outside as the weather was very nice.

data.title: All You Can Eat!
data.text: The All You Can Eat Sushi is the way to go if you want 3+ things on the menu. It was so delicious and the service was great from our server Dare. The only thing is the All You Can Eat is semi limited if you want the pure fish and rice sushi but you can always order a la carte as well. Definitely will go back next time I'm in Tucson!

data.title: Prepare to wait
data.text: Have been here twice and 45 min wait each time. Seems to be a very popular place for the local college crowd - several tables had groups of 10 or more and this was a sunday night. Extensive sushi and sashimi offerings plus an all you can eat option that was rather confusing. For this, you indicate your choice on a card - choosing as many as you want but you will be charged additionally if you dont finish it and you cant share with someone who did not order the same thing. Beer, wine and mixed drinks available.  Service was rather uneven and waiter brought things we diddnt order and seemed confused about what he was doing.

data.title: all you can eat RICE
data.text:
Way too much rice, chef not too friendly and waitress nowhere to find. 
This was the last time I go there.

data.title: Terrible Tucson Tuna
data.text:
So disappointed by this experience. Line out the door, so we were expecting the food to be good. Sat at the sushi bar and looked at menu. Menu had a number of items marked out. A large number of the rolls include fillers like cream cheese, cucumber, avacado, etc. I have never had a 'Spice Tuna Roll' that had anything other than spicy tuna in it. They put cucumber, cream cheese and avacado, with a minute amount of tuna, yet the roll is rolled huge because of the abundance of rice. We ordered just a tuna roll, and the quality of the tuna was so poor, the tuna itself was pale pink, almost translucent. You could tell this was the quality of fish that they buy for $2/lb on wicked tuna. The Vegas roll was so inedible, we pushed the roll away and didn't eat over half of it. Normally I don't write derogatory reviews, and you can see my last to validate, but I am hopeful that if this is read someone will think about this before spending good money on an inferior product. 

Having moved here recently, we were hoping to find a good sushi place, but we were sadly disappointed. Wished we had gone to the pizza place next door. I guess what we gained in southwestern cuisine in Tucson, we definitely lost in sushi. Does sound funny looking for a good sushi place in the middle of the desert...

data.title: Loved It!
data.text: My wife, new UA graduate daughter, & I had dinner here and loved it! The menu was excellent as was the service and dish. Our food order was delivered very quickly and we had great interactions (just the right amount) with the staff. Definitely recommended.

data.title: Quite Good
data.text: A friend and I stopped here for dinner. The hostess was extremely friendly and so were the wait staff. They have a wide variety of sushi and other items to choose from with accompanying pictures and explanations. Everything we ordered was fresh and delicious. I would definitely visit this restaurant again.

data.title: Kids Heaven
data.text: Our kids love this restaurant for their rolls and edamame. Once again the chefs were on point. They are experiencing a little construction work outside but not a real problem. Our server was very friendly and attentive to our needs.
